page.title: 11AYMESTREY VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The village{Post Office}and shop occupy the lower part of a building with living premises above,built 6yrs ago to replace a lock-up shop. The owner is a native of the county and runs the shop with the aid of two part-time staff. The shop is open five and a half days a week,{Mon to Fri -8.30 to 5.30 and{Sat morning.}Most of the trade is with locals but there is a good passing trade. It sells staple goods and a great variety of other goods. Off-licence sales include French and German wines, and of course local ciders. It is much more than a shop - it is one of the centres of social life of the village where contacts can be maintained, news passed and messages left for friends. The village would lose its character without a shop.
